result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis R Smithlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $200.00 applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis R Smithlin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:33 pm cases called-16CF60, 16TR865, & 16TR866. Defendant Travis R Smithlin in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Oswald.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached and stated on the record-State moves to amend Count 1 to Misd. Poss of THC in violation of 961.41(3g)(e).  Attorney Oswald concurs-argued sentence.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts amendment by the State.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2, 16TR865, & 16TR866. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Oswald. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 12 months. CONDITIONS: Court will allow early termination after 6 months if joined by agent. AODA and follow through.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeffrey Thomas Oswald in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Oswald requests plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on August 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Oswald, Dated 7/12/2016 Re: Request to Adjourn STC on 7/19/2016
Status conference on July 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Travis R Smithlin in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson makes statement regarding PTC-defendant is requesting more time to seek counsel. Discussion between court and defendant regarding counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 16CF-60, 16TR-865 and 16TR-866 - All Cases Called @ 4:00 PM: Defendant Travis R Smithlin in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def unsure at this point on the counsel issue.   Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.
